info.title: GitHub Repos
info.description: A GitHub repository is the most basic element of GitHub. It's a place where you can store your code, your files, and each file's revision history. Repositories can have multiple collaborators and can be either public or private.

get.description: Retrieve the file content of a repository. This action only works with files less than 100 MBs.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path including the file, if desired.

delete.description: Deletes a file from a repository.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

put.description: Creates a new file or replaces an existing file in a repository.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

get.description: Retrieves a zip archive of a repository.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

get.description: Retrieve a list of repositories that the authenticated user has explicit permission (read, write, or admin) to access.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository without the .git extension. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.
